definition: "Wohl" is an adverb that is commonly used to express a sense of likelihood or probability. It is often employed to convey a sense of assumption, speculation, or supposition about a particular situation or outcome. Additionally, "wohl" can also indicate a state of well-being or contentment, suggesting a sense of comfort or satisfaction.

examples.german: Wohl dem, der eine gute Frau hat.
examples.english: Blessed is he who has a good wife.

examples.german: Er ist wohl der beste Spieler in der Mannschaft.
examples.english: He is probably the best player on the team.

examples.german: Das Essen war wohl nicht gut, denn keiner hat es gegessen.
examples.english: The food was probably not good because no one ate it.

examples.german: Sie hat wohl vergessen, mich anzurufen.
examples.english: She probably forgot to call me.

examples.german: Er ist wohlhabend und kann sich alles leisten.
examples.english: He is wealthy and can afford anything.
